sections.title: Overview
sections.content: The External Backup plugin allows you to automatically backup your ChurchCRM database to WebDAV-compatible cloud storage services. This includes popular services like Nextcloud, ownCloud, or any server supporting WebDAV protocol.

sections.title: Configuration
sections.content:
To configure external backups:
1. Go to Admin > Plugins and find 'External Backup (WebDAV)'
2. Click the settings icon to expand the configuration panel
3. Enter your WebDAV endpoint URL (e.g., https://cloud.example.com/remote.php/dav/files/username/backups/)
4. Enter your username and password
5. Optionally set an auto-backup interval in hours
6. Save your settings

sections.title: Auto-Backup
sections.content:
When auto-backup is enabled (interval > 0 hours), ChurchCRM will automatically create and upload a full database backup at the specified interval. The backup runs as part of normal page loads, so the system must have regular user activity to trigger backups.

Recommended intervals:
- Daily backup: 24 hours
- Twice daily: 12 hours
- Weekly: 168 hours

sections.title: Manual Backup
sections.content:
You can also trigger a manual backup at any time:
1. Go to the External Backup settings page (Plugins > External Backup)
2. Select backup type (Database Only or Full Backup)
3. Click 'Backup to WebDAV Now'

Database Only backups are smaller and faster. Full backups include uploaded photos.

sections.title: Testing Connection
sections.content:
Before relying on external backups, test your connection:
1. Go to Plugins > External Backup
2. Click 'Test WebDAV Connection'
3. Verify you see a success message

Common issues:
- 401/403 errors: Check username and password
- Connection timeout: Verify the endpoint URL is correct
- Certificate errors: Ensure the WebDAV server has a valid SSL certificate

sections.title: Supported Services
sections.content:
Any WebDAV-compatible service works with this plugin:

- Nextcloud (recommended)
- ownCloud
- Synology NAS
- QNAP NAS
- Box.com (with WebDAV)
- Apache mod_dav
- nginx with WebDAV module

Note: Some services require app-specific passwords for WebDAV access.

sections.title: Security Considerations
sections.content:
Important security notes:

1. Always use HTTPS endpoints to encrypt backups in transit
2. Use app-specific passwords when available (Nextcloud, ownCloud)
3. Store backups in a folder with restricted access
4. Periodically download and verify your backups are valid
5. Consider encrypting sensitive backups with external tools before uploading
